description.narrative: The IFC investment would: (i) Increase generation from renewable assets by 158 MW representing 2% of the country's generation capacity and help Serbia meet its national strategy and EU renewable energy targets as a candidate country; (ii) Reduce CO2 emissions (the Project is expected to avoid 388,047 tonnes of CO2 every year during its operation) and contribute to climate change reduction; and (iii) Support GoS' goal of increasing private sector investment in the power sector where 99% of energy generation is still owned by the state.

The proposed investment involves providing debt financing for a 158 MW greenfield wind power plant, in the Kovin municipality Serbia (the Project). The Project is wholly owned by Vetroelektrane Balkana d.o.o - WEBG (the Project Company), a limited liability company incorporated in Serbia. The capital expenditure required to implement the Project amounts to approximately EUR 300 million. Construction of the project has commenced in 2017 and commercial operations are expected to begin by Q4 2018/Q1 2019. The Project is being primarily developed by Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company PJSC (Masdar) and the generated electricity will be sold to the Serbian guaranteed supplier of electricity i.e. Elektro Privreda Srbije (EPS) under a 12-year Power Purchase Agreement.

name.narrative: The proposed site is located about 50 km to the north east of Belgrade in Kovin municipality. The site covers an area of approximately 3,700 ha on reasonably flat terrain with ground elevations ranging between 127 m and 150 m above sea level.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

sector.narrative: V-BC - Wind Power - Renewable Energy Generation
